Description: A condition caused by algae growing on the surface of tea leaves.
Why it occurred: Caused by a variety of algae species, including Chlorella sp. and Scenedesmus sp.
Prevention measures: Plant tea bushes in well-ventilated areas and avoid overwatering.
Recommended steps to cure the disease: Remove algae from tea leaves by washing them with clean water.

Description: A fungal disease that causes brown spots on leaves and stems.
Why it occurred: Caused by the fungus Colletotrichum theae-sinensis.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties and avoid overwatering.
Recommended steps to cure the disease: Apply a fungicide such as copper or mancozeb.
